decks.notes: The deck focuses on creating a fast and explosive synergy between various Elf creatures, utilizing cards like Glimpse of Nature and Wirewood Symbiote to generate card advantage and mana acceleration. The key goal is to assemble the necessary resources to cast cards like Natural Order and Green Sun's Zenith to search for powerful finishers like Craterhoof Behemoth for a quick and overwhelming win. The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent by quickly building a formidable board presence and unleashing a lethal combo.

The main concept of the deck is to generate a large number of mana through cards like Gaea's Cradle and Heritage Druid, and then use that mana to cast powerful creatures like Craterhoof Behemoth. The deck also aims to draw through the deck quickly by using cards like Glimpse of Nature and Green Sun's Zenith to find key combo pieces. The deck contains a number of Elves that work together to ramp up mana and allow for explosive turns, making it a fast and efficient combo deck.

The main concept of this UWx Control deck is to disrupt opponent's strategy by countering spells and removing threats while maintaining card advantage through card draw and manipulation. The focus is on controlling the game through powerful control tools such as Force of Will, Counterbalance, and Jace, the Mind Sculptor, while also utilizing efficient removal like Swords to Plowshares and Terminus. The deck aims to control the pace of the game, stabilize the board, and eventually win with threats like Entreat the Angels.

The main focus of this Aggro - Dragon Stompy deck is to disrupt the opponent's mana base using cards like Blood Moon, Magus of the Moon, and Chalice of the Void, while also applying pressure with aggressive creatures like Goblin Rabblemaster and Sin Prodder. The deck aims to quickly establish a board presence and lock down the opponent's ability to cast spells effectively, leading to a swift victory through direct damage or overwhelming control of the game.

The deck aims to generate massive amounts of mana through Gaea's Cradle and untap synergy with cards like Wirewood Symbiote and Quirion Ranger. It utilizes the Elf tribe to quickly swarm the board with creatures, drawing cards and playing additional creatures with Glimpse of Nature. The key combo involves using Natural Order to fetch a Craterhoof Behemoth, giving all creatures a massive power boost and potential for a lethal attack. The deck also includes disruption with cards like Leovold, Emissary of Trest and Reclamation Sage to disrupt opponents' strategies.

The main focus of this Legacy Aggro-Delver deck is to quickly disrupt the opponent's hand and board state while applying pressure with efficient, aggressive creatures. The deck includes a variety of disruption spells like Hymn to Tourach and Abrupt Decay, as well as counterspells like Daze and Force of Will to protect its threats. The deck also utilizes powerful creatures like Delver of Secrets and Tarmogoyf to apply pressure and close out the game quickly. It aims to control the game tempo and outpace the opponent to secure victory.

This deck focuses on assembling the necessary resources to generate a large amount of mana quickly and efficiently, allowing for a powerful combo turn that can finish the game in a single explosive play. The cards in the deck are designed to set up the combo by digging through the deck for key pieces, disrupting the opponent's strategy, and generating mana to cast spells. The main goal is to storm off with spells like Infernal Tutor and Tendrils of Agony to deal lethal damage and win the game before the opponent can mount a defense.

This Grixis Aggro deck focuses on disrupting the opponent's game plan while applying pressure with efficient creatures like Delver of Secrets, Young Pyromancer, True-Name Nemesis, and Gurmag Angler. The deck also utilizes disruptive spells like Daze and Stifle to slow down the opponent, while Lightning Bolt and Dismember provide removal options. Force of Will helps protect key threats and Spell Pierce provides additional countermagic. The mana base includes cards like Wasteland and dual lands to ensure smooth mana development. The deck aims to control the game and finish off the opponent quickly with its aggressive creatures.

This deck focuses on controlling the game through card advantage and countering opponent's spells. The key strategy revolves around utilizing cards like Jace, the Mind Sculptor, Monastery Mentor, and Snapcaster Mage to generate value and incremental advantage. The deck aims to control the board with cards like Terminus, Council's Judgment, Swords to Plowshares, and counter spells like Counterspell and Force of Will. It also utilizes the Sensei's Divining Top and Counterbalance combo for additional control. Overall, the deck aims to outlast and outmaneuver opponents with a variety of control tools.

The deck focuses on quickly getting out big creatures like Griselbrand and Emrakul using the Show and Tell combo, while having alternative strategies like Sneak Attack and Omniscience. It includes protection with counterspells like Force of Will, and card selection with Brainstorm, Ponder, and Preordain. The deck also includes Cunning Wish for additional versatility and Intuition for setting up combo pieces. The mana base includes fast mana sources like Lotus Petal and Ancient Tomb to quickly ramp into the big creatures, along with the necessary fetch lands and dual lands for color fixing.

This Canadian Threshold deck is focused on aggressive play, utilizing low-cost, efficient spells and creatures to apply pressure on the opponent. The deck aims to control the board with countermagic while quickly deploying threats like Nimble Mongoose, Hooting Mandrills, and True-Name Nemesis. With a mix of cantrips like Ponder and Brainstorm to ensure consistent card draw and manipulation, as well as disruptive cards like Force of Will and Stifle, this deck seeks to maintain tempo and outpace the opponent in Legacy matches.

The main concept of this UWx Control deck is to control the game through a combination of counterspells, removal spells, and card advantage. It utilizes powerful control cards like Counterbalance and Sensei's Divining Top to manipulate the top of the deck and control the flow of the game. The deck also includes powerful win conditions in the form of Jace, the Mind Sculptor and Entreat the Angels. By managing resources and disrupting the opponent's game plan, this deck aims to outlast and outmaneuver opponents until it can deploy its win conditions and secure victory.

The deck aims to create an infinite combo using Aluren and Cavern Harpy to continuously loop creatures from your hand onto the battlefield without paying their mana costs. This combo is supported by card draw and disruption spells like Brainstorm, Force of Will, and Abrupt Decay to protect the combo and disrupt your opponent's game plan. The inclusion of Shardless Agent and Baleful Strix provide additional value and synergies with the combo pieces. The deck's mana base is carefully constructed to support the various color requirements of the spells.

The main concept of this deck is to control the game through card advantage, manipulation, and disruption. By using cards like Jace, the Mind Sculptor, Snapcaster Mage, and Terminus, the deck aims to control the board state and keep the opponent from gaining momentum. The deck also utilizes cards like Counterbalance and Sensei's Divining Top to counter spells and control the top of the opponent's deck. With a mix of card draw, removal, and counter spells, the deck aims to outlast the opponent and secure victory.

The main concept of this deck is to establish a strong board presence early on through efficient creature threats such as Baleful Strix, Deathrite Shaman, and Tarmogoyf, while disrupting the opponent's game plan with cards like Thoughtseize and Force of Will. It also aims to generate card advantage and tempo with cards like Edric, Spymaster of Trest and Leovold, Emissary of Trest. The deck utilizes a combination of aggressive creatures, disruptive spells, and efficient removal to control the game and win through incremental advantage.

The deck focuses on quickly playing powerful Eldrazi creatures and disrupting the opponent's game plan with cards like Chalice of the Void. The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with aggressive creatures and powerful abilities, supported by mana acceleration and disruptive spells. With the ability to quickly deploy threats and disrupt the opponent's strategy, the deck aims to end the game quickly before the opponent can assemble their own game plan.
